description.raw: I implemented minibatch training in the Segway trunk, where each training iteration uses a random subset of the include_coords windows rather than all of them.  Minibatch training allows training to touch every position in the genome while maintaining fast iterations.  It is controlled with the --minibatch-num-windows option.  It selects random windows from --include-coords, so you want to use the full genome for --include-coords.  Likelihood-based stopping criterion is no longer valid with minibatch training, so I made it so that it always to max-train-rounds if --minibatch-num-windows is set.
description.html: I implemented minibatch training in the Segway trunk, where each training iteration uses a random subset of the include_coords windows rather than all of them. Minibatch training allows training to touch every position in the genome while maintaining fast iterations. It is controlled with the --minibatch-num-windows option. It selects random windows from --include-coords, so you want to use the full genome for --include-coords. Likelihood-based stopping criterion is no longer valid with minibatch training, so I made it so that it always to max-train-rounds if --minibatch-num-windows is set.
